mim.author: ZMDSCHN
mim.name: ComTop
mim.description: This is the top level of the Ericsson Common Information Model (ECIM). This model contains the singleton, root Managed Object Class (MOC) ManagedElement under which the complete model is contained. Directly under ManagedElement are managed-function level classes SystemFunctions, Transport, Equipment and the root MOC of any managed functions. The Equipment Root MOC is in the Equipment Managed Object Model (MOM). The root MOC for a managed function is hosted in the managed function MOM.

struct.name: ProductIdentity
struct.description: Deprecated, Contains product information for a Managed Element and ManagedFunction(s). Replaced by ProductData.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description: The product number in Ericsson ABC format. For information, refer to Ericsson Corporate Basic Standards.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description: The product revision in the form R[1-9][A-Z]. For information, refer to Ericsson Corporate Basic Standards.

enum.name: SchemaFormat
enum.description: The Schema formats of the supported data models.

enumMember.name: MP_DTD
enumMember.description: The data model format is XML based on mp.dtd.

enum.name: AdmState
enum.description: The administrative state of a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: Use of the resource is administratively permitted to existing instances of use only. While the system remains in the shutting down state the manager may at any time cause the managed object to revert to the locked state.

enum.name: OperState
enum.description: The operational states of a resource.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource partially or fully operable.

enum.name: BasicAdmState
enum.description: The basic administrative states for a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

derivedDataType.name: DateTimeWithoutOffset
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of local date and time (ISO 8601). The following pattern describes the DateTimeWithoutOffset format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second
DateTimeWithoutOffset values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTimeWithoutOffset format is further restricted as follows: - T designator is upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

rule.exceptionText: Must be of the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.S+] where T separates the time and the date parts. Example 2000-08-01T17:17:34.1.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: DifferenceFromUTC
derivedDataType.description:
Time zone difference between the local current time and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The format is as follows: [+/-]hh:mm
It is expressed as positive (that is, with the leading plus sign [+]) if the local time is ahead of or equal to UTC of day and as negative (that is, with the leading minus sign [-]) if it is behind the UTC of day. Example: +01:00

rule.exceptionText: Must be of the format HH:MM with a leading + or â€“ sign where HH = Two digits of hour (00 through 23) and MM = Two digits of minute (00 through 59). Example +02:00.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the International Standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part followed by a time part. When the time part represents local time, as opposed to UTC time indicated by Z as last character, an additional time offset part is added to the DateTime string.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format in detail: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = four digit year MM = two digit month (01=January, etc.) DD = two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = time designator (shows start of time component) hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = one or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = time is Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

derivedDataType.name: IpDNSAddress
derivedDataType.description: The IpDNSAddress type represents an IP address or a DNS domain name. A version 4 IP address is specified in dotted quad notation, for example 130.100.92.154. RFC 791 describes the syntax details. A version 6 IP address is specified by 8 groups of 16 bit hexadecimal values separated by colons, for example 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334. RFC 4291 describes the syntax details. A DNS name is specified as a fully qualified domain name, for example myhost.ericsson.com. Internet domain are loosely specified but RFC 1034 recommends a syntax.

class.name: ManagedElement
class.description: The top-level class in the Common Information Model is Managed Element root Managed Object Class. From this class, all model entities are contained. The Managed Object Class (MOC) has attributes that provide information on the Managed Element Identity, primary location and the products it contains.

attribute.name: managedElementId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: siteLocation
attribute.description: A freetext attribute describing the geographic location of a Managed Element.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: A freetext string for additional information to assist Managed Element identification.

attribute.name: productIdentity
attribute.description: Contains product information for the Managed Element and its Managed Functions. This attribute is deprecated.

attribute.name: localDateTime
attribute.description:
Deprecated. This is the local date and time for the Managed Element. The following format is used: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss
The meaning of each field is as follows: YYYY = four digit year MM = two digit month (01=January, etc.) DD = two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = time designator (shows start of time component) hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) The hyphen [-] and the colon [:] are used as separators within the date and time of day expressions, respectively.
attribute.statusInformation: Deprecated at version 2.3. Functionality replaced by TimeM model.

attribute.name: timeZone
attribute.description: DEPRECATED. This is the timeZone in which the Managed Element resides. The possible values for this attribute are defined in the public-domain zoneinfo or Olson database. Locations are identified by a string indicating the continent or ocean and then the name of the location, typically the largest city within the region. See http://www.iana.org/time-zones for more information. Example: Europe/Stockholm.
attribute.statusInformation: Deprecated at version 2.3. Functionality replaced by TimeM model.

attribute.name: dateTimeOffset
attribute.description: Deprecated. Difference between the value of the localDateTime attribute and UTC.
attribute.statusInformation: Deprecated at version 2.3. Functionality replaced by TimeM model.

attribute.name: dnPrefix
attribute.description: It provides naming context that allows the managed objects to be partitioned into logical domains. A Distingushed Name (DN) is defined by 3GPP TS 32.300, which splits the DN into a DN Prefix and Local DN, for example DN format: dnPrefix=<DN Prefix>, localDn =<Local DN> Fault Management: dnPrefix does not impact Fault Management, since an NMS recognises a Managed Element by IP address Performance Management (PM): The dnPrefix is present in the PM Data file, Result Output Period (ROP) file, if the dnPrefix attribute is specified, that is, not an empty string. Example: DC=ericsson.se,g3SubNetwork=Sweden Example: DC=ericsson.se,g3SubNetwork=Sweden

attribute.name: managedElementType
attribute.description: The type of product being managed. For example the type could be RBS or CSCF.

attribute.name: release
attribute.description: The release of the product type specified by the attribute managedElementType. It commonly contains the Managed Element release, for example L12.0, 13A, R1A

attribute.name: logicalName
attribute.description: Optional identifier for the managed element. Used for legacy Ericsson model compatibility towards some third-party management systems.

attribute.name: locationName
attribute.description: Provided for 3GPP alignment. The physical location (e.g. an address) of the Managed element.

attribute.name: vendorName
attribute.description: Provided for 3GPP alignment. If set, it shall contain 'Ericsson AB'.

attribute.name: userDefinedState
attribute.description: Provided for 3GPP alignment. It may hold an Operator-supplied state in free text form.

attribute.name: swVersion
attribute.description: Provided for 3GPP alignment. The software version of the ManagedElement.

attribute.name: managedElementTypeList
attribute.description: Provided for 3GPP alignment. If set, it should describe a Managed element's functionality or a combination of functionalities.

attribute.name: networkManagedElementId
attribute.description: Replaces the value component of the RDN in the COM Northbound Interface. This attribute shall, if used, be set to a simple string which adheres to 3GPP MO Naming Convention . The value should be unique within the network namespace.

class.name: SystemFunctions
class.description: This model has a purpose to group the management of the system functions of the Managed Element.

attribute.name: systemFunctionsId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: Transport
class.description: This is a container for common transport functions used within the Managed Element.

attribute.name: transportId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: legacyId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: admState
attribute.description: Legacy attribute deprecated in ECIM_Top and moved to ECIM_CommonLibrary.

attribute.name: basicAdmState
attribute.description: Legacy attribute deprecated in ECIM_Top and moved to ECIM_CommonLibrary.

attribute.name: dateTime
attribute.description: Legacy attribute deprecated in ECIM_Top and moved to ECIM_CommonLibrary.

attribute.name: ipDNSAddress
attribute.description: Legacy attribute deprecated in ECIM_Top and moved to ECIM_CommonLibrary.

attribute.name: operState
attribute.description: Legacy attribute deprecated in ECIM_Top and moved to ECIM_CommonLibrary.

attribute.name: schemaFormat
attribute.description: Legacy attribute deprecated in ECIM_Top and moved to ECIM_CommonLibrary.

relationship.name: ManagedElement_to_Transport
relationship.description: Containment association of the Transport MOC.
